page.para: A long time a/go, all the an/i/mals crawled on the ground. They had no legs!
Gau/tam had on/ly giv/en legs to boys and girls.
One day, Gau/tam an/nounced he would give legs to eve/ry an/i/mal.
The an/i/mals were hap/py to hear the news. They wagged their tails and flapped their wings.
Gi/raffes, li/ons, el/e/phants, rab/bits, croc/o/diles, and birds all went to get legs.
Some an/i/mals were giv/en four legs. Oth/ers were giv/en two legs.
The last an/i/mal in the queue was the mil/li/pede. How man/y legs would he get?
Gau/tam had a lot of legs left. So he gave them all to the mil/li/pede.
As soon as the mil/li/pede had left, the snake ar/rived. The snake had o/ver/slept!
Gau/tam looked eve/ry/where. But there were no legs left.
Since that day, Snake does not sleep much. He does not want to miss his next chance to get legs.
